title: Rogers changing his mind in a big way
post: It’s interesting to note, as Dan told me by email, that Joe Nickell have used this particular quote from Rogers to back-up his anti-Shroud agenda!  That means one thing: There are always many ways to understand one quote from someone!  I wonder if bloggers agree with my interpretation of Rogers quote or if they see things more like Nickell…
author: Yannick Clément

title: Rogers changing his mind in a big way
post: This is not at all clear. What, in the end, was Roger’s final opinion? It should be in keeping with his scientific papers.
author: Louis

title: Rogers changing his mind in a big way
post: This quote of 1978 was the first impression of Rogers.  It’s important because it shows that along the way, he completely change is opinion when he learned new facts and observations, especially the ghosts of coloration found by Adler.  This and many other facts and observation leaded him to conclude that the body image on the Shroud must have been formed by a natural formation process that acted at normal temperature.  For me, this quote clearly shows the honesty and professionalism of Ray Rogers.

title: Rogers changing his mind in a big way
post: Yes indeed.  This is one of the many things that made Ray Rogers a world-class scientist.  Anyone who says differently has no idea what they are talking about.
author: Andy Weiss

title: Rogers changing his mind in a big way
post: In fact, that’s how science SHOULD always work.  You got new data and facts that shed new lights on a topic :  you adjust your conclusion in consequence.  Rogers did that.
